body.p: Natural risk factor for any organization carrying PCI data. Serious reputational risk for Client, and existential risk for The Company.

ol.li: Breach of network through employee workstations (malware, phishing).
Breach of network through network attack (unpatched vulnerability, security misconfiguration).
Breach of network through Shop application (data disclosure bug, code vulnerability leading to compromise).

section.p: Overall, risk of card data loss is significantly reduced as card data is destroyed after two weeks - only the last four digits remain.

ol.li: EndPoint security programs, network separation, education, least privilege principle.
Rigorous patch policy, frequent scanning and remediation, logging and monitoring.
Application functionality (cards are not collected or disclosed, card data is encrypted), testing, frequent framework patching.
DLP program, principle of least privilege, low turnover.
